as heavy as before, and like a moderately thick paste, & that it is not so easy to handle as when it is liquid. It is a sign that it is cooked enough, which you will know when it also throws off big bubbles or exhalations, in the middle & around, as long as a
finger
. Seeing it in this state, remove it from the fire, for it is heated enough, because if you were to reheat more, it would be too much & would not set as well. For when it becomes red & overheats, it loses its strength & spoils the
sand

sands
